title: Veraheim - City Layout & Structure
atAGlance:
**Total Permanent Residents**: 3,500
**Temporary Visitors**: Variable (50-200 at any time?)

### By Employment Category

**Guards**: 300 total
- Basic guards: ~270
- Lieutenants: ~27 (9 border + 12 watch + 6 misc)
- Commanders: 3 (shift commanders)
- Living arrangements: Mostly Level 2 employee housing, commanders in Castle

**Artisans & Craftspeople**: ~700-800
- Master craftsmen with shops: ~250 (50 professions × 5 shops)
- Apprentices and journeymen: ~450-550
- Living arrangements: Mix of Level 1 (mid-level) and Level 2 (employee)

**Merchants & Traders**: ~400-500
- Shop owners (Lower Plaza): ~150
- Warehouse workers: ~100
- Trade facilitators: ~150-200
- Living arrangements: Level 1 (mid-level) for owners, Level 2 for workers

**City Administration**: ~200-250
- Senior officials (in Castle): ~30-40
- Mid-level administrators: ~70-80  
- Clerks, tax collectors, record keepers: ~100-130
- Living arrangements: Castle (senior), Level 1 (mid), Level 2 (basic)

**Service Workers**: ~800-900
- Inn/tavern workers: ~200
- Road maintenance: ~100
- Sanitation: ~100  
- Lift operators/maintenance: ~50-100
- Market workers: ~150-200
- Various laborers: ~200-250
- Living arrangements: Mostly Level 2 employee housing

**Families & Dependents**: ~1,100-1,200
- Spouses and children of workers
- Elderly residents
- Living arrangements: Share housing with working family members

### By Housing Level

**Level 3 - Grand Castle**: ~200 residents
- Vera and Galdor
- Senior officials: ~30-40
- Guard commanders: 12 (4 shift × 3 commanders)
- Elite staff and their families: ~150

**Level 1 - Mid-Level Housing**: ~800 residents  
- Guard lieutenants: ~30 + families
- Successful merchants: ~150 + families
- Master artisans promoted up: ~100 + families
- Senior service supervisors: ~50 + families

**Level 2 - Employee Housing**: ~2,500 residents
- Guards: ~270 + families (~400 total)
- Artisans and apprentices: ~500 + families (~800 total)
- Service workers: ~700 + families (~1,100 total)
- Various laborers and workers: ~200 + families (~200 total)

### Temporary Visitors

**Short-term** (staying in inns/taverns): 50-200 at any time
- Traders waiting for cargo
- Travelers passing through tunnel
- People seeking citizenship (application process?)
- Diplomatic visitors
- Refugees being evaluated

**Does not include**:
- Those in the Floating Docks (hundreds? not counted as Veraheim residents)
- Tunnel guards stationed at ground level (counted separately?)

commonKnowledge: ### Housing Philosophy **Critical Principle**: **No one owns a house in Veraheim.** Housing is **awarded as part of your job/contribution**: - Based on rank and responsibility - City-provided, not purchased - Merit-based system reflecting Vera's vision - Ensures equality - wealth doesn't determine housing quality ### Three Housing Categories **1. Employee/Guard Tier**: - Basic contributors to city - Guards, craftsmen, laborers - Standard housing quality **2. Mid-Level Management/Lieutenant Tier**: - Supervisors, skilled artisans, guard lieutenants - Better housing, more space - Recognition of greater responsibility **3. High-Ranking Officials/Commanders Tier**: - Senior administrators - Guard commanders - City leadership - Housing in the Grand Castle ### **Those Who Don't Contribute Are Not Welcome** **Veraheim is NOT a charity**: - Must have a job that adds value to earn housing - Temporary visitors pay for lodging at inns - Refugees given [evaluation period TBD] to find contribution role - Those who **can't** work (elderly, disabled) are supported by families OR retirement benefits - Those who **won't** work are expelled to Floating Docks or forced to leave **Retirement Benefits - Earned Through Lifetime Service**: - Citizens who contribute sufficiently throughout their lifetime earn retirement - **Triggered when**: Body or mind can no longer handle their job - Race-neutral: Doesn't matter if you're a 60-year-old human or 400-year-old elf - Individual assessment: Can YOU still do YOUR job? - Injury, age, illness - all valid reasons - **Benefits**: Same quality of life until death - Keep your current housing tier - City provides for needs (food, healthcare, etc.) - Dignity in retirement after lifetime of contribution - **Enhanced by City Tokens**: Multiple [Tokens of Appreciation](/factions/veraheim-the-sanctuary#City Token of Appreciation) can: - Qualify you for retirement sooner - Provide better retirement accommodations - Recognize exceptional service - **This is EARNED**: Not a right, a reward for dedication - Ensures no one is abandoned after giving their best years **The Philosophy**: - Everyone contributes = everyone benefits - Lifetime contribution = lifetime security - No freeloaders draining city resources - 3,500 people all pulling their weight - This is WHY Veraheim functions so well - Equality means equal responsibility AND equal reward --- ### Vertical City Structure (South to North) The city is built in **terraced levels** rising from the South Lift (harbor entrance) up to the Grand Castle carved into the northern mountain wall. --- ### LEVEL 1: Lower Plaza (Harbor Level - South) ### The South Lift Arrival - Largest of three lifts (handles heavy cargo from ships) - 10 harbor-side guards stationed here - Customs and initial inspection point - First impression of Veraheim for most visitors ### The Main Lower Plaza **Function**: Commercial hub for local and imported goods **Surrounding Stores**: - **Local crafts**: Goods made in Veraheim - **Imported goods**: Items from ships/caravans - **Trade stalls**: Merchants displaying wares - **Food vendors**: Local cuisine - **General supplies**: Daily necessities **Atmosphere**: - Busiest, most diverse area - Multiple languages spoken - First contact point for new arrivals - Markets and commerce from dawn to dusk ### Housing: Mid-Level Flanking Plaza **Location**: East and west sides of the Lower Plaza **Residents**: Mid-level management and lieutenants - Guard lieutenants (the 9 who lead border/watch units) - Warehouse supervisors - Senior merchants - Skilled craftsmen who've earned promotion **Housing Quality**: - Better than basic tier - Multi-room accommodations - Close to commercial activity - Prestigious to live near plaza --- ### THE MAIN STAIRS (Transition) **Height**: Approximately 20 steps - Wide enough for cargo transport - Separates commercial from craft districts - Symbolic threshold - from trade to creation - [Exact height in feet TBD] --- ### LEVEL 2: Crafter's District (Middle Level) ### The Crafter's District Plaza **Function**: Heart of Veraheim's artisan economy **Surrounding Workshops**: ALL artisan workshops circle this plaza - Blacksmiths - Tailors - Carpenters - Leather workers - Jewelers - Potters - Weavers - Weapon/armor smiths - [Every craft profession] **The 5-Shop System**: - Each profession gets 5 shops around the plaza - Every 5 years, challenges determine who holds these shops - Workshop space is premium real estate - Master craftsmen work and display here **Atmosphere**: - Sounds of crafting: hammers, looms, saws - Smell of leather, metal, wood - Apprentices running errands - Quality over quantity ### Housing: Employee/Guard Tier Flanking Plaza **Location**: East and west sides of Crafter's Plaza **Residents**: Basic employees and guards - Standard guards (not lieutenants) - Apprentices - Laborers - Service workers - Road cleaners, tax collectors **Housing Quality**: - Clean, maintained, but basic - Smaller accommodations - Communal aspects (shared spaces?) - Honest work earns honest housing ### Taverns & Inns (This Level) **Location**: Mixed in with employee housing, east and west **Function**: - Social gathering for workers - Accommodation for temporary residents (before earning housing) - Entertainment for off-duty guards - Community centers **Examples** [Names TBD]: - [Worker's tavern name] - [Guard's favorite inn] - [Artisan gathering spot] --- ### THE GRAND STAIRS (Transition) **Function**: Ascent from working city to administrative center **Characteristics**: - Even more impressive than Main Stairs - Symbolic passage to power - Guarded? [TBD] - Ceremonial importance --- ### LEVEL 3: The Grand Castle (Highest Level - North) ### Carved Into Mountain Wall **Architecture**: - Carved directly into the northern mountain face - Blue-roofed towers (visible on map) - Blends natural stone with construction - Impressive and imposing ### What's Inside the Grand Castle **Administrative Offices**: - City management - Record keeping - Tax collection headquarters - Guard command center - Meeting rooms for city business **Courts**: - Legal proceedings - Dispute resolution - Where City Tokens of Appreciation hearings happen - Judgment chambers **Hosting Areas**: - Diplomatic reception halls - Banquet rooms - Meeting chambers for important visitors - Rooms for negotiations with Empire/Kingdom representatives **Housing - High-Ranking Officials**: - **Senior staff**: Top administrators, chief judges, master of guards - **Guard commanders**: The three shift commanders live here - **Special cases**: Honored citizens? [TBD] **The Royal Residence**: - [Vera Wyrdweaver](/npcs/vera-wyrdweaver)'s quarters - Galdor Ruincalen's quarters - Shared spaces for the rulers - Private and secure - [Specific layout TBD] --- ### The Three Lift Locations All three lifts arrive at **Lower Plaza level** (Level 1), but on different sides: ### South Lift (Harbor Access) **Location**: Center-south of Lower Plaza **Traffic**: **Busiest** - constant maritime cargo and passengers **Guards**: 10 harbor-side guards **Immediate Area**: - Customs house for ship cargo - Main entry to Lower Plaza - Warehouse facilities - Cargo sorting and distribution - First contact point for most visitors --- ### East Lift (Aloria Entrance) **Location**: Separate platform on the **east side** of Lower Plaza **Traffic**: Moderate - humans using tunnel or visiting city **Guards**: 10 border guards ("East Gate") **Immediate Area**: - Customs for land travelers from [Aloria](/factions/aloria) - Inspection point for tunnel traffic - Usually human traders and merchants - Some suspicion but generally welcomed (they bring trade) - [Specific facilities TBD] **Atmosphere**: - Business-like - Less formal than West Lift - Humans are more comfortable here than elves in Veraheim --- ### West Lift (Thelassian Entrance) **Location**: Separate platform on the **west side** of Lower Plaza **Traffic**: **Lightest** - elves reluctant to visit **Guards**: 10 border guards ("West Gate") **Immediate Area**: - Formal customs area - Extra security protocols - Tense atmosphere - Most elves who come are on official business only - [Specific facilities TBD] **Atmosphere**: - Formal and cold - Elvish visitors are rare - Guards extra vigilant - Political tension palpable --- ### Lower Plaza Layout ``` NORTH ↑ [Main Stairs to Level 2] WEST EAST [West [Mid-Level MAIN Mid-Level] [East Lift] Housing] PLAZA Housing] Lift] [South Lift] ↓ HARBOR ``` The Lower Plaza is a **central open space** with: - **Center-South**: South Lift arrival and Main Plaza - **East Side**: East Lift platform + Mid-level housing - **West Side**: West Lift platform + Mid-level housing - **North**: Main Stairs ascending to Level 2 - **Surrounding**: Shops and stalls around the plaza --- ### Additional City Features [To be developed] ### Watch Stations (4 total) - Where are they located? - 3 guards each (2 watchmen + 1 lieutenant) - Magical lights? - Who maintains city lighting? ### Temperature Control - Mountain city - cold? - Heating systems? - Natural insulation from stone? --- ### Social Dynamics by Level ### Lower Plaza (Level 1) - Most diverse - Constant activity - Temporary residents - Commercial bustle - Gateway to city ### Crafter's District (Level 2) - Permanent residents - Community identity - Pride in craftsmanship - Social cohesion - "Real" Veraheim ### Grand Castle (Level 3) - Elite and privileged - Access restricted? - Political center - Distance from common folk - Does this create resentment? --- ### Questions to Develop 1. **East and West Lift Placement**: Which level? Separate platforms or integrated into Lower Plaza? 2. **Population Estimate**: How many people per level? Total city population? 3. **Vertical Movement**: Just the stairs? Or other ways to move between levels? 4. **The Castle Interior**: Specific rooms, layout, Vera and Galdor's private quarters? 5. **Guard Distribution**: Where are guards stationed beyond the lift platforms? 6. **Missing Services**: - Temples/religious spaces? - Schools/education? - Healing/medical? - Entertainment venues? 7. **The Contribution System Details**: - Who decides housing assignments? - Can you move up in housing tier? - What if you lose your job? - Waiting list for housing? --- ### To Name - Specific taverns and inns (Crafter's District level) - Notable shops in Lower Plaza - Specific workshops/craftsmen in Crafter's Plaza - Guard commanders who live in Castle - Areas/districts (do they have informal names?) ---
